Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; three added white bands; exterior: Three bands separated by double dilute lines at rim: diagonal strokes, stopt maeander and zigzag; below, painted decoration consisting of part of short-horned goat walking to right (hind end and lower forelegs lost; pendant roundels, dots and rosettes as filling ornament; at far right, vertical broken maeander framing the panel.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as being in the style of the Würzburg chalices, but dated later than those chalices because she considers the style of the drawing to be debased and because of the elementary and isolated interior decoration (Lemos 1991, 72-3). The black glaze is applied unevenly on the interior surface of the sherd. The diagonal marks are not part of any interior decoration.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 43 note 96, p. 72, p. 235, no. 140, pl. 13)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (p. 138, no. 691)
Williams 2006a / The Chian Pottery from Naukratis (p. 127, p. 132 note 11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0187) (phase 2)
